website_summaries.verdict: Ceramic titanium-coated flat iron that can get up to an impressive 410 degrees Fahrenheit fast. Anti-static technology fights against unwanted frizz.
pros: The irons have 6 heat settings from 310 degrees Fahrenheit to 410 degrees Fahrenheit and heat up fast
Digital controls and LCD screen are easy to use and view
Titanium coating is strong, durable, and adds longevity to the product
Auto shutoff is a welcome addition
cons: Some users find the lowest setting too hot, especially for fine or color-treated hair

customer_reviews.title: Sparks from the cord connection
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flat iron almost 2 years ago. It’s done a decent job until about a week ago when it started shocking me from where the power cord connects to the unit. Today, while using it, I heard a loud POP, saw a flash and smoke, and felt a zap. See attached photo. A large spark from the end of the iron where it’s connected to the cord burned my arm. Needless to say, I threw it in the trash. Buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: Neutron

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheap replacement for my nice straight iron, and unfortunately came upon this one. The “floating” irons do nothing but pull my hair. I have easy to straighten hair and this makes it take twice as long because when I put it on high heat, it was barely warm enough to straighten my hair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fire Hazard!! Buyer Beware!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Good flat iron but it hasn't lost that "electrical burning" smell that usually goes away after a few uses. I'm worried that it might have an electrical short and could cause a fire. I waited too long to be able to return it, so I've had to toss it. A $20 flat iron isn't worth burning down my house.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Quinton

customer_reviews.title: Horrible straightener, it says "anti static" it should be ...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible straightener, it says "anti static" it should be called "static inducer". It's cheaply made, and it works terribly, hence, the cheap price. Don't waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A steal for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised! Heats up quick, able to create beautiful curls and it was my first time curling with a flat iron! In addition I accidentally discovered 2 locking mechanisms for the temperature and to also keep the iron closed as I curl!
customer_reviews.author: Sweet2Lynn

customer_reviews.title: It works very well but it Stinks & my hair Stinks
customer_reviews.text: This flat iron work very well, no complaints. It stinks like bug spray and when your done with your hair your hair smells like bug spray. I cleaned the flat plates with a damp cloth and Dawn thinking it was oil from the machine works. No it didn't work. I decided to "burn" it off by letting it stay on for 20 minutes, let it cool and do it again. My bathroom, bedroom and living room smells like bug spray. Not good. Would I buy this product again no. Seller is great
customer_reviews.author: AnneB

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay turned on.
customer_reviews.text: I only had this for 2 months and it stopped working correctly. It just shuts off repeatedly and won't get hot. It worked great before the issue started. Thank goodness for Amazon being so generous in their return and refund policy.
customer_reviews.author: RSKSA

customer_reviews.title: The G.O.A.T., Greatest Of All Time.
customer_reviews.text: Best I’ve ever had in my life!! I’ve been burning, I mean straightening, my hair for over 15 years and this straightener is the best. When my first one died after almost 10 yers I cried. I tried out a few other ones until I just purchased this same one last year again. I use it to straighten, wave and curl my hair. This is one product that I would be the spokeswoman for... hint hint, if anyone is listening. No but all silliness aside, stop scrolling and hit “buy now” and thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: Carina Carina

customer_reviews.title: very good Straightener
customer_reviews.text: It's really good and works perfectly, loved this straightener. So far I haven't find any problem with this one.
customer_reviews.author: AKumar

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you think its dual voltage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because all the comments stated it was dual voltage. When I received the package it only stated 120, but i read a comment that said it only says one but works just fine in other countries. My first time using it was in South Africa, and it burnt out. I'm disappointed in this product because I only bought it for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: One or two swipes with this bad boy, and you would think I'm a model ...
customer_reviews.text: You just cannot beat the price-for-quality on this one. My hair- think combination of Ronald McDonald and Hermione Granger. Electrocuted. One or two swipes with this bad boy, and you would think I'm a model for Suave. Due to my profession, I am required to wear my hair up and slicked back, and I've never been a fan of the gel look. I'm a girl- I like something soft and feminine. This tames even my edges and fly-aways, and people cannot believe that my hair isn't naturally straight. And this is with rain, perspiration, high humidity and a job that doesn't believe in mirrors or letting you fix your hair. Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.author: Tronks

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: If you need a cheap flat iron that actually straightens your hair this is a great option! There are multiple temperature settings (not a vague 1-10 setting) and it seems pretty durable (it has a good weight to it, it's not feather light like other cheap flat irons). It straightened my frizzy hair on the 390* setting in minutes and it stayed all day. For $17 I would recommend giving this flat iron a shot.
customer_reviews.author: DDR0825

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how this got such great reviews. It’s a piece of sh*t. It falls over when you put it on the counter. The plates don’t touch each other except at the very end (see photos of this straightener and my old Remington straightener). It pulls your hair by getting stuck in the plastic. No thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Great for curling hair!
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is exactly what I wanted. It is rounded so hair is easily curled with this wand. The plates are long so a lot of hair will fit. I get static a lot in my thin hair, and this hasn't made me static-y at all! I didn't want to spend more than $40 on one of these and the reviews on this were too good to pass up. I recommend this product. Only complaints 1) The increments it goes up are weird to me. 2) The outside does get a little more warm than I'd like but just be mindful of finger placement.
customer_reviews.author: Michala Cameron

customer_reviews.title: which I like more of a smooth
customer_reviews.text: This straightener is exactly what you get for the price. After my beloved Chi straightener finally kicked the bucket after 7 years of faithful use, I needed a quick and cheap replacement. I was excited to find a Remington straightener this cheap! It does an OK job, but I find my hair is often still a bit frizzy and big after straightening, which I like more of a smooth, very straight look from my straightener. I also think that it's not great for the health of my hair - it makes my ends look super dry and scraggly. It's definitely okay for the price! But I'd rather spend more and get a better quality straightening job.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes O’Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing straightener for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had all kinds of straighteners over the years. I've had very expensive ones, Chi, Babybliss, Amika, you name it. This model by Remington has been the best one I've owned by far. For one, it's very cheap. Who can argue with $20 bucks? Two, I'm on my second one but my first one lasted me four years. Eventually it just wouldn't turn on but I used it nearly every single day for four years so I expected it. It doesn't pull your hair, it's thin enough to also do waves or curls, and it heats up quickly. It's light and packs up nicely. I can't say enough good things. If you're at all debating, get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like, returned.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like this flat iron maybe the one I've been using isn't good but it worked and was easy to use. this flat iron felt like strange almost like it's for kids I'm not sure how to describe it. It didn't straighten my hair well either, I have wavy hair and my old flat iron worked better. I returned this item and I'll keep looking for a flat iron that I do like. On the positive I must say so far it's been rather simple to return an item to Amazon. I thought it would be a pain and was a concern ordering online but so far it's been very hassle free.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly (Kyber3000)

customer_reviews.title: Long-lasting
customer_reviews.text: I've never written a review before, that should tell you how I much I love this straightener. I first bought this iron over 7 years ago, and it started dying about a week ago. It would take several tries to turn it on, though it was fine once it was on. I have a bad perm at the moment, and don't have time in the morning for a fussy appliance. Anyway, I've had this iron for over 7 years, and with regular use it's now starting to die. Not bad for something I paid $20 for!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah McKnight

customer_reviews.title: Burnt my hair
customer_reviews.text: Wow I ain't someone to talk somebody from Mexico recommended this and I couldn't think of anything worst this actually I put it on 410 and it burned my hair the ends were coming off and I almost lost the chunk of my hair thank God my hair is short I just had to shave it a little more because it was horrible what is this to my hair plus it left a stinky smell the plates aren't titanium and this thing is just like ironing your hair with a ion machine
customer_reviews.author: catalin

customer_reviews.title: Amazzzzzing
customer_reviews.text: This flat iron is the best I have ever used.I purchased thinking it's 20bucks why not try it out. I was in shock of the heating power! I had chi and babyliss pro and it doesn't compare to this flat iron. It glides through hair without frizzing or static. (Btw I have 3b curly hair that is hard to straighten.) Amazing!! Picture is 3 days after I straighten.
customer_reviews.author: Mememe

customer_reviews.title: Great especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter broke my chi, then I got an expensive flat iron at one of those mall kiosk that suddenly died on me with no warning after a year. Wasn't expecting much with this flat iron but I was so wrong. I do my daughter's hair as well and we're so pleased with this iron...
customer_reviews.author: tpowe

customer_reviews.title: Plates don’t meet flush
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible. The plates don’t meet flush without my squeezing them so hard that I must be destroying my hair. Having straight hair isn’t worth the stress of worrying about damage from a poorly designed hair straightener. I stopped using this because of this. Also the controls are impossible to use if you have long nails. All the other good reviews must either be from people who got one better than mine or who have greater grip strength. Sigh. Have to buy another one from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: TheArtGrandTour

customer_reviews.title: Only does tiny sections of hair.
customer_reviews.text: Heats up quickly and doesn’t pul hair, but the surfaces don’t touch the whole way. Only really straightens or curls a 1” section at a time. ETA: used this again on my daughters. It’s awful. The surfaces just don’t touch well at all. I used a different brand that belongs to my sister and the difference is astronomical. This is garbage. And I’ve missed my return window.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina M.

customer_reviews.title: A great straighter in great budget
customer_reviews.text: A great straighter in budget. I have been using it for almost a year and I am not disappointed. I am not sure of the damage caused so I always pair it up a good heat resistant spray. The colour is pretty and the size is perfect for travelling. I bought it on a recommendation from my roommate and I too highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: I am the minority here
customer_reviews.text: I got on amazon to find a highly rated straightener. I already have a pretty nice one (highly rated as well but about $10 more) but I’m bored with it and wanted to upgrade. I was expecting to pay good money for something. I seen all the raving reviews so I tried this. All I can say is you get what you pay for. Could be better than some high end straighteners but didn’t hold a candle to mine. It’s just ok to me. It doesn’t smoothly go over my hair. It takes a few times going over it to straighten my already pretty straight hair. Just ok.
customer_reviews.author: April Brozik

customer_reviews.title: The iron heats up and straightens just fine. The lcd screen on it has caved in
customer_reviews.text: The iron heats up and straightens just fine. The lcd screen on it has caved in, though, after just a couple uses. I don't squeeze particularly hard, so it just seems like the plastic is lower quality than expected. Makes me feel like the whole thing will break sooner than it should. I didn't return it, because it became too late to do so, before I realized. So, I just have it in a closet as a backup for if my trusty Wet2Straight stops working.
customer_reviews.author: wowmandango

customer_reviews.title: Black Girl/Processed Hair
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't feel as heavy as the Herstyler (which falls apart every 7 months or so) so the heat transfer isn't very good even though the setting goes high. I like the auto-shut-off, but if you have thick, curly, or textured hair, there are better options at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: N. Washington

customer_reviews.title: It works great.
customer_reviews.text: People complained about the smell and the fact that the surfaces don't touch a few inches from the tip. Yes, it does smell a little while it is warming up. Yes, it doesn't touch beyond the first couple inches at the end. I have thin fine hair and I turned it up to 370 deg. and I go slowly down my hair and get perfect results without trying to squeeze the surfaces together. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, pulls hair, plates barely touch
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap look and feel. Casing is cheap plastic, looks nothing like the picture. Plates only touch at the tip. You have to squeeze hard to get the one floating plate to compress enough to make the plates touch along the whole length, which obviously pulls hair badly and makes your hand sore after a couple minutes. Returning, complete waste of my time and now I've got to shop for another straightener.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: None other than best straightener for the best price!
customer_reviews.text: This straightener is everything I hoped and expected since 90% of why I chose this particular one was because of other womens reviews. I've yet to use it to curl my hair, but as far as straightening, it did it well and very quickly. I've got naturally straight hair anyway, but everytime after a shower I let my hair air dry it will dry somewhat straight, but will just have ugly waves in it, and my hair is very thick. For the price, this straightener is awesome! Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: For Readers Like You...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on Amazon, had to get three replacements from Remington because the plates didn't even touch! After three of the same iron, with the same problem, they finally sent me an upgrade. It too was crooked, not anywhere near as bad and would actually straighten our hair! Would not repurchase or recommend. The cord is much too short as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ally Troyer

customer_reviews.title: Great hair straightener!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Remington hair straighteners for years and have always loved them. They are great prices for a great quality hair straightener. They last for years and I usually only end up buying a new one when I drop it to many times and it breaks. So of course I broke my last one by dropping it and bought this one to replace it and am loving it so far. It straightens my hair nicely and for 17 bucks that is a great price. I like the auto shut off feature and it heats up quick and gets hot. Super happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JandD

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Shipped really quickly and opened it immediately. Nothing was wrong with the packaging, it was perfect. I absolutely loved the color & used it right away. Made my hair feel silky smooth and heated up fast. No bad smell of a new steaightener. I dont need a really high temp so i left it on 350 and it worked great. Definitely a recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Performs like an expensive product
customer_reviews.text: I love this straightener! It heats up fast and the auto off feature is great! I also really like the locking mechanism. I'm really rough on it and it's been great! Bought one in 2014, bought another for my sister. 2016 my dog ate the chord so I bought another. The power button has started sticking recently so I'm getting another. For $20 and throwing it around and submerging it in water to cool off to pack in suitcase I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Burnett

customer_reviews.title: I'm a novice.
customer_reviews.text: I found the "pros" of this flat iron are: heats FAST, straightens STRAIGHT, is lightweight and reasonably easy to handle for someone just getting used to it. The "cons" would be that I couldn't get it as close to the base of the scalp as my curler, so I have super-straight hair from about 3/4" off the scalp forward but wavy at the scalp. Odd. Also, you should be able to manipulate it to create a little curve to your ends. I'm still learning at this point.
customer_reviews.author: KFL

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I had Remington hair straightened that my daughter had and left for me. It was at least 10 years old. But recently, I noticed that it was not working likes it was. So, I looked under Good Housekeeping for good ones. It was ranked #2. The rest were almost $100. I opened it up and it was so light weight. I had my doubts at the point but, my hair turned out great. It looks so much better and smoother. I made a great choice. There's only one little thing that I wish was different. The display would be a lot easier to read if it was lit up. It's totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: VAWL

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time if you have thick curly hair
customer_reviews.text: Very upset.. I have thick curly hair and this barely straightens my hair. I even blew my hair out as straight as I can before and it just doesn't work. Don't waste the money. Also. Pretty sure mine is used because it came out of the package it was just the straightener loose in a box... can it be returned that way?
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good price & good company!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this, but it seems to be well made. It heats up quickly & does what it is supposed to do. I also noticed that Remington is owned by Spectrum Brands. I had dealings with their customer service department regarding a different brand that Spectrum owns, and they were wonderful! I read a lot of reviews on various products & I noticed many comments where Spectrum has stepped in to fix an issue with their products. I'm very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Betty A. Chilly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Flat Iron!
customer_reviews.text: I love this flat iron! It heats up fast and has a wide range of heat settings. The temperature lock is a great feature that many other flat irons don’t have. With the lock on you’ll always have a consistent temperature without risk of scorching your hair because you accidentally turned the heat up. The iron is super smooth and with the anti-static feature you don’t have to worry about frizzies or fly always. It has a nice long swivel cord that doesn’t get twisted up or tangled. This is a great iron at a very affordable price!
customer_reviews.author: SisuGal

customer_reviews.title: Short circuit?
customer_reviews.text: Update: Had the same problem with the one I purchased from the drug store. I am HIGHLY disappointed. I had this same flat iron for years and then had to replace it after I accidentally stepped on it. The new replacement never worked! I would turn it on and it would stay on for 15 seconds or so and then turn off. In order to do my hair, I would have to keep turning it back on over and over again. Like I said, I loved my old one, so I purchased a new one from the drug store so I could easily return it if it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Pandagrl408

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. Makes my hair very nice. I had very expensive one before...wasn't happy with it at all... but this one is easy to use. Doesn't take long to get hot. Reasonable price. I use leave-in conditioner as well..that helps to protect your hair from getting dry. And although where I live is humid my hair stays straight. In general I suggest you to try it.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Great temp, bad design
customer_reviews.text: I like the heat control. It's a digital reading, but it's right where I would place my thumb when using the appliance. I had to re-adjust, which was strange because of the balance of it in my hand. I wish the display window was an inch lower on the wand. It's also rounded on the bottom, so it rolls over when I set it down, instead of staying upright. If it lays over too long, it can scorch the counter. I love that it turns off after 60 minutes! And it heats up in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Beth S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for mylar bags
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to heat seal mylar bags for long term food storage. I bought a cheap one because this is all I need it for. It is easy to use, just plug it in, turn it on, and select the temperature. It heats up quickly and seals the bags with one pass on 325F temp setting. Very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: gdfan78

customer_reviews.title: it would shut off and cool down. Because it was the only flat iron ...
customer_reviews.text: I had such high hopes for this flat iron BUT the first time I used it shut right off. I could cry! It would heat up for about 30 seconds and then all of a sudden, it would shut off and cool down. Because it was the only flat iron I had at the time I had to turn it back on about 100 times (not exaggerating) just to do my whole head of hair. Desperately disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was worried this flat iron would be pretty cheap because of the price tag but I’m happy to report that (so far) it seems to be a great buy! Love how smooth it is. Heats up fast and HOT! It doesn’t feel cheaply made and the size is perfect for straightening or curling my shoulder length hair. I actually put my Chi away and kept using this one that I bought with the intention of using only for travel. As of today 8.23.18 I have been using this iron everyday for just over a couple weeks and haven’t had one issue. Hope that continues to be the case.
customer_reviews.author: Bl8n

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this thing. I bought it based on the rave reviews and great price. It did not glide over my hair, it tugged even with Redken Pillow Soft thermal spray. Left my hair looking frizzy. Thermal spray usually helps the iron glide. I also tried Rusk thermal shine spray with it. Nope. No shiny hair that you would expect with an iron with such great reviews. Sent it back and spent a LOT more for the BabylissPro porcelain ceramic straightener and I love that thing. I have coarse curly hair, even at the highest setting of 410° this should have straightened it.
customer_reviews.author: Gina M

customer_reviews.title: It Works! :)
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this purchase! The price is unbeatable and it does a wonderful job of straightening my hair. I have colored, curly hair and the 350 setting works fabulously without burning my hair. PROS Digital number of settings. Heats up fast. Straigtens hair CONS I could only get the ends of my hair to curl even though I watched 3 videos on how to do it. Hint: I suggest reading the Remington's guideline as to what the the appropriate temperatures would be for my hair type. If I had used my previous flat iron setting which is 410 degrees, it would have burned my hair. Thanks Remington for providing the guideline sheet!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have come to the conclusion that you do not have to buy expensive to get a product that works great. This little flat iron heats up quickly with multiple levels of heat to choose from. The cord doesn't twist and is long enough for great use. I am able to straighten my very curly hair with this easily and quickly - and believe me I have lots of hair. I also can use it to make beach waves which is so easy and fun!
customer_reviews.author: coffeemom78

customer_reviews.title: floating plates broken, digital screen is poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this, as it was cheap and got really awesome reviews. However, only 1 of the plates was actually floating. And it definitely kept snagging/pulling my hair. It seems to take a little while to heat up and doesn't hold the heat well. Pros: it's lightweight, has a locking function to keep plates together, swivel cord, auto-off (allegedly but I did not test this), cheap Cons: only 1 floating plate (or broken), doesn't reduce static as far as I can tell, definitely made my hair static-charged, the digital screen is dark, doesn't light up and can't read it well, uneven heat
customer_reviews.author: Smiths

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This piece of crap worked for a week and then started turning itself off and having trouble turning on at all. Returning. Really needed it right now before a date, and it's let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Clark

customer_reviews.title: This is an wonderful tool
customer_reviews.text: This is just the best thing I could EVER buy. I was waiting for this package to come just to use it. First thing in the morning was wash my hair (I have long, abundant hair) so I need to use my newly. At first I was very concerned about damaging my hair since I have NONE experience doing this, I always visited the beauty salon. I must say I love it, it's easy to use. It doesn't really need to much knowledge. I'd recommend the use of both product together to keep your hair damage free.
customer_reviews.author: AliehS

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This was a cheap straightener compared to my $150 chi that i last had so I was kind of skeptical on how long it would last. I've now had it for about a year and it works well. Mind you, I dont straighten my whole head of hair- mainly my bangs in the AM but it does work well when I have done my whole head. I also do loose beachy waves when I dont want to whip out the curling iron. It shuts off after a while of not using it, which is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: 808bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Better than CHI!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product!! I have thick hair and medium stains thickness. This it amazing. I like it better than the CHI. It wont cost you the bank!
customer_reviews.author: Dbacken

customer_reviews.title: Returning After Single Use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like it, but it's going back. Where you place your fingers on the straightener gets extremely hot. Even when not using force, your hand does get tired keeping the plates closed b/c the plates only meet at the very tip. Some hair got caught underneath the plates quite a few times (thank goodness I was only using it on a wig). It's not worth the aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: T. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Important to read instructions on temperature settings
customer_reviews.text: I love this hair straightener!!! It's been over several years since I've had a new one and I bought this despite all the bad reviews. You have to read the instructions. There's certain temperatures for different types of hair texture you have. Mine I use between 37°f-39°f. If you have really thick hair and coarse hair I would go up a bit higher but it gets hot quickly! Also it really is anti static. Before it used to take me about an hour to straighten my hair on my old one now I get it done in about 20 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: LOVE! Bought 2 2-4 years ago. Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This was my third one to buy! I have four daughters and have had the other two for 2 or 4 years now. They both still work great! I bought another one because they were fighting over them and they were cheap. Straightens as good as an expensive one and way better than those cheap ones at Target or the old cheap Conair one I used to have. My teenage daughters use theirs constantly and its still going strong. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Susan H.

customer_reviews.title: Good for me
customer_reviews.text: I still have this after 2+ years I don’t use it very often because I’m trying to keep heat out of my hair. It’s great for thin to medium thickness hair. I set mine to 370 and it’s hot within 20 seconds. No frills and does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Barrera

customer_reviews.title: It straightens.
customer_reviews.text: Box was impossible to open without ripping. Iron heated up pretty quick. Smelled like when you light a sparkler but that was expected for first time use. Straightened my fine, thin, untextured (except for frizz) hair just fine. Extremely light weight so hoping it won’t die out quick. *edit after second use* The display screen for the temperature is right where I hold it at so the glass covering the screen is pushed in. Took minimal effort obviously since it isn’t hard to clamp a straightener. Hopefully it doesn’t go any further down and ruins the display. Holding it any higher is hot and any lower doesn’t have the right effect to clamp it right.
customer_reviews.author: Stormyy

customer_reviews.title: Best Flat Iron!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best flat iron for the money. It is lightweight, easy to use, easy temperature control. I have had many brands, including much more expensive, such as Chi, but I like this just as well. It is good for my hair texture, but if you have fine hair, you may want it lower than the 310, which is the lowest setting on this one. But, I highly recommend! Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Happy at last

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I have wavy, long hair. This flat iron gets very hot fast and light weight. My experience with other no name brands is when i run it through my hair it would catch or pull on my hairs. This one runs very smoothly through my hair and effectively. I can finish my hair in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Ari Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Glad to Catch This Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a great, inexpensive iron! It hasn’t been a month yet but I’m loving this flat iron. Initially bought it as backup iron for travel but I’ve been using it regularly. Sleek design with extra long plates make styling quick & easy - doesn’t tangle or stick. Heats up quickly with temp controls. Locks & slender for throwing in bag to travel. Well priced!
customer_reviews.author: spsmama

customer_reviews.title: Great straightener,  great price, would work on any hair type
customer_reviews.text: This is a great straightener, gets very hot very fast. When writing the review, it asked me to grade on drying power: THIS IS NOT MEANT TO BE A DRYER. I would never use this on wet hair... Ever!!!
customer_reviews.author: 4051kris

customer_reviews.title: Budget-Friendly and one of the best!
customer_reviews.text: I have thick, wavy/curly hair and have been using a CHI since 2007. It always took forever to straighten my hair, and even then it never felt like it did when I went to the salon. I decided to try this straightener since I was on a budget and holy cow, I am impressed! I straightened my hair before work this morning and I swear it took half the time it did in the past. I only had to do one pass-through for it to be super straight! I'm definitely impressed with this purchase and would recommend it to anyone looking for a budget-friendly straightener that does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Kate B.

customer_reviews.title: The product
customer_reviews.text: I have this product for 7 months and definitely the best economic investment at a very good price and very good quality, however, it has improved my hair is ironed in less than an hour So highly recommended in case you want to go out I do one night and do not have much time to ironing I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Arregue Soledad

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and Shiny Hair
customer_reviews.text: My mom and I love this straightener. It makes our hair look very straight and shiny and silky. I honestly was not expecting this straightener to make my hair so shiny but I am surprised. When I straighten my hair it looks like I came out from a shampoo commercial or something lol. Good value for the money. Mom loves it because her new straight hair makes her look young.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Best straightener hands down!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING DEAL!!! I have always spent good money on hair products and tools. I wasn’t wanting to drop another $200 on a straightener when my Paul Mitchell one went out. I figured I’d buy this one and if it wasn’t any good it was just $20 so I’d cut my loses. Omg it better the my $200 straightener! Love it! I love that the temperature settings go over 400 I also love the small width. Great for my bob type hair style! If you have short hair it’s a most have for sure
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Natural Hair FRIENDLY!
customer_reviews.text: So I'm a 4b/c and I don't flat iron my hair often, I only do it once year and only during the winter months. But this flat iron is BOMB the ceramic plate is everything, so no frying of the hair like a metal flat iron would. There's visible heat setting so no need to worry or have a guessing game with the possible temp. Of course it's still a flat iron so there is still risk of heat damage but this is a great product that needs to be used wisely.
customer_reviews.author: Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a natural hair wearing African-American woman and I must say this is by far the best flat iron I've ever had for less money. I deep conditioned, washed, blew out wild detangling my hair and flat ironed each section as I blew it out so I could clip my split ends as I went. I was impressed and I'm excited to finally be able to hold my own at home instead of wasting money on hair dressers who don't care about my locks.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel F

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but great quality! Works well on my fine and wavy/frizzy hair for straightening, waves, and curling
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Remington 1" flat iron for about 6 months now and love it! I bought this to replace my much pricier Chi flat iron after it died. This flat iron seems to be just as good of quality as my old Chi before it died & works great on my shoulder length, fine, wavy/frizzy hair. I used it to straighten, curl, and add waves - all accomplished with ease. My hair glides right through and I love that you can control the temperature easily and it also automatically turns off if I forget and leave the house. Would definitely suggest trying this flat iron - it's super cheap but still great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: this one is amazing! It heats up very fast and my frizzy ...
customer_reviews.text: Its been years since I bought a new hair iron, this one is amazing! It heats up very fast and my frizzy curly hair becomes smooth and straight! My old straightener would make it straight but it would somehow still be frizzy. This is also great for getting all those baby hairs.
customer_reviews.author: Dudu Lieder

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have thin straight hair. I use this flat iron to curl and I think it works fantastically!! It's not scorching my hair and it's doing the job I need done. For the price, the value is wonderful!!!
customer_reviews.author: SingleClutchMom

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a variety of hair styles.
customer_reviews.text: Have really enjoyed this flat iron for different hair styles. Can use for volume, beach waves, curls, or straightening hair. I use a heat shield spray on hair and adjust temperature for my fine, thin hair. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: blueeyes

customer_reviews.title: Not as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to order this straightener as it's the number 1 seller on Amazon. However I wasn't very impressed by it. It is hard to keep it standing on any flat surface, it keeps rolling. The plastic is a matt dull purple, not vibrant and shiny as pictured and the plastic heats up and it's hard to hold and press to make ringlets. On the other hand, it does heat up fast. I can imagine that this would be a good option for someone with thin hair.
customer_reviews.author: Raniamus

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered this flat iron twice. It's pretty in purple, my favorite color. When the first one just stopped working, I assumed that maybe my sister (who sometimes uses my stuff, too) had accidentally broken it. It was pretty inexpensive, so I just ordered another. But the new one only worked for about a week and then it stopped heating up. This time, only I was using it. I hadn't done anything wrong with it. Unfortunately, I didn't get around to returning it or requesting a refund in time. But I will not be ordering this flat iron again. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: princesspetite

customer_reviews.title: This flat iron is AMAZING!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This flat iron is AMAZING!!!! I have been natural for a little over 4 years and finding the right flat iron for your hair is difficult. I am pleased to say that I have found the one for me. At right under $15, I was concerned but was thinking, it's only $15 bucks why not give it a try. I am very pleased! I have thick hair but I am able to straighten my hair with only two passes, three at the most, but I don't usually need a third pass). This product is light weight and east to handle. Oh and the long plate is an extra bonus I can't believe I ever had to live without.
customer_reviews.author: ♥ Tiffany ♥

customer_reviews.title: Love My Shiny Hair Look
customer_reviews.text: Best Iron I ever had, I had previously had one of those pricey Irons that they sell at the malls. Which is a complete scam It stopped working properly after only a few months. As for this Remington Iron I am very happy with the results I got, my hair looked really shinny and I lasts a long time even a couple days, where as with the other "fancy" one It started going back to wavy after a few hours. I am very pleased with this buy and the price I paid. It also heats up supper fast I was able to straighten my hair in a very short time compared to the old one I had.
customer_reviews.author: GueriitaBebe

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It certainly does the job! Great price, great little straightener. I can’t say that my hair gets plastic odor after using the iron, as some reviewers have complained. My hair just smells like whatever produc I put on it to protect from heat. The iron itself does smell a little bit when heated up but it doesn’t bother me at all. I use it occasionally, from time to time, and it works perfectly for me.. Totally happy with it! ...and the price of course :)
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. H

customer_reviews.title: PURPLE
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a new hair straightener since my old one was a little worse for the wear. I very much enjoy how you can control the degrees of the temperature. I'm currently trying to reduce the damage I do to my hair and it's very refreshing to see more temperature options that just HIGH or LOW. Also the little locking mechanism is awesome! Helps to take up less space in storage. Also it being in purple makes my little heart happy ❤
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't close tight enough, you have to hold it closed to get a firm fit. Reading the temp is hard because the display is not backlit. Heats up quickly, but the contrast btwn the print and the white of the model is poor and hard to read. I have to hold it up to the light to see which button to push. It's just OK.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Best Hair Appliance I’ve Owned—EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I’ve owned and ONLY because I gifted the first one to a dear friend who’d lost her mom at 15 and felt beautiful after I straightened her hair. It was already 6 years old and still working PERFECTLY. After I gave it to her, which was a simple decision (obviously), it was as simple a decision to buy the same one again. I’ve used $120 straighteners and they’re no better than this one. You should use a heat protectant no matter how expensive your straightener is, but this is by far the best one I have ever used. I still can’t believe what it costs.
customer_reviews.author: GoettlSA01

customer_reviews.title: Finally broke, had to replace.
customer_reviews.text: My mom bought me this flat iron I want to say about 10 years ago. It finally gave on me so I went searching on amazon for a new one. Funny enough this same one happened to be one of the first results. I’m mixed and have very thick, curly hair. This flat iron is so smooth and gets my hair pin straight. I can also do curls and waves with this iron that come out better than my curling wand. Anyway for this flat iron to be this cheap it lasted me forever. I 10/10 recommend on natural hair
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heats quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have thicker hair, so when I'd use my old straightener, I'd have to tackle sections, then stop, let it reheat, and repeat until I was done. This one heats up quickly, and stays hot, so I'm able get it all done much faster. It stays cool to the touch on the outside. It's light and doesn't take up much space. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Begley

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but very good product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this flat iron for the first time in 2012 (just checked my orders). It worked great - so when it finally died earlier this year, I purchased another one. I have coarse hair and it does the job at 370° The reason I’m reviewing it now is that I keep seeing these really expensive flat irons out there, and I had to come back to see how much I’d paid for mine. I can’t speak to how wonderful the others are, but if I’m getting what I need from this one, I’m good!
customer_reviews.author: Martha Z

customer_reviews.title: Will not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I personally feel like this flat iron did not work well I tried it I sent it back it didn’t straighten my hair well it just seem like it was actually not working good.
customer_reviews.author: Shantell Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Amazing straightener!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this straighter and have absolutely been loving it! It leaves my hair super straight. With the other straightener I have purchased in the past (and they were way more expensive than this one) my hair wouldn’t last straight all day. By the evening it was all frizzy. I’ve always had difficulties with straightens not straightening good enough but I must say, I am beyond impressed with this one! It heats up quickly and leaves my hair super super straight.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Best Iron Ever... NO pulling out hair.
customer_reviews.text: This is the very best flat iron I have ever used! Based on the great reviews that said it didn't pull your hair, I bought it and they were right. I can run the iron through my hair either straight or twisted to make waves and it doesn't pull any out. The width of the plates makes it so easy to work with and I love the heat settings. I keep mine on the lowest which is 310 because I have color treated blonde hair. I am so happy with this purchase! Update: I’ve had this iron over two years and it still going strong! I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: maggie black

customer_reviews.title: Such a good deal!
customer_reviews.text: I love this straightener. I have used many expensive ones over the years all on which plates eventually cracked whether it was ceramic or tourmaline. This one I’ve had just about a year now and has been durable. My only annoyance is how the power button is so easy to click when in use. I’ve accidentally turned it off midway thru my hairstyling more time than I can count. Otherwise this product is perfect. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amae92

customer_reviews.title: Really good and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I have seen a lot of reviews of people saying that the plates doesn’t touch together at the end, but I did some research on the net and a hair stylist said that it is fine for a flat iron’s plate to not be touching each other at the end. I used it and I am really surprised! It works really well. The temperature control is really good and it heats up fast and evenly. I am a newbie at doing my own hair and I only used about 15 to complete my whole head at my first try. I doesn’t make your hair frizzy and doesn’t give off a weird smell like some people said it does.
customer_reviews.author: JessL

customer_reviews.title: A straightener that last 💕
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 2 years, 2 weeks and 6 days (yes, I had to be as specific as possible), and I love this straightener. For only $17.84 this straightener is amazing. I have not had any issues at all with it. Is the smell the best ? No ! Unfortunately what straightener doesn’t smell like hair being straightened. I haven’t had any burning smell like some other people have , but I guess I was just fortunate. I would recommend this and feel as though you won’t know what experience you get unless you try it. Good luck everyone 💕🎈
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HAIR STRAIGHTENER
customer_reviews.text: It keeps my long coarse hair well managed and straightened. Although , it does add some shine I wish it could have made my hair more shiny. But it does a perfect job of straightening hair even without adding any serums or sprays. It also helps in detangling the hair easily after my blow dry and causing my hair to shed less ! Thank you !
customer_reviews.author: Nabiha

customer_reviews.title: Too high heat
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't go below 310, which is extremely hot. i cant even imagine the horrendous damage being done to your hair at 350 and above, 310 is already "3rd degree burn if your hand brushes against it" hot... everything else about the flat iron is good, but I will be buying a new one because I like to style my fine caucasian hair with heat in the upper 200s. Idk why they even sell a straightener that doesn't go below 300, their curling wand does.
customer_reviews.author: mattie

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is wow! I'm really impressed. I'm 53 years old, I have naturally curly hair. 6 months ago, my hairdresser said that I should spend the money and buy a good, expensive flat iron. So..... I did. Still could not get the bumps out of my hair. So I purchased this one. I actually thought it would be smaller, but that's ok, because it's truly a great product for a fraction of the cost. I would buy it again and would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: PENNIES FROM HEAVEN

customer_reviews.title: Heats up to 450 degrees
customer_reviews.text: Heats up to 450 degrees. It straightens hair quickly with first pass and it doesn’t pull your hair. Great iron for the price. Bought this one for my daughter since she keeps stealing my more expensive one. This one works just as good as my expensive one if not better. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Really good straightener, especially for styling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this straightener to have in addition to one I already had. My other one is too wide to do any of the styling techniques such as curls or crimps (Pinterest if you don't know what I'm talking about), but this one is perfect. Much better and more durable than I thought it would be based on the price. Really good straightener, especially for styling. Update: after over 6 months, I LOVE this straightener even more. It's so good that I actually get rid of my main straightener (which was 5x as expensive). I can't believe that such a great straightener cost less than $20.
customer_reviews.author: whataryderTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Errrrr...
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews about this product, I thought it would be a win. Upon receiving the item, I just recently finished using it and not satisfied. Though it heats up ( placed it on the highest setting ), the temperature was not enough to smooth the slightest frizz. In addition, the plates do not completely touch. The inner sections of the plates do not touch like the sections toward the top which leaves an inconvenient gap, thus making straightening uneven.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Scheidt

customer_reviews.title: For a little iron it works great
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure if I was going to Like it or wasn’t sure if it was going to work since I have thick hair and I’m use to a 3” plate. (And I did cut my hair shorter) Well it works great granted I need to do smaller pieces but it does straighten fast enough that it doesn’t take me long.
customer_reviews.author: Mc

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed and needed something in a pinch that didn't cost ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a Hot Tools Flatiron those much more expensive. I don't use it often and it did not even last 2 years. I was very disappointed and needed something in a pinch that didn't cost as much. I read the reviews on this and decided to order and it is seriously amazing! I have a ton of hair that is very wavy and it straightened it out in about 20 minutes and it looked great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like described.
customer_reviews.text: This flat iron works very well. It heats up in 30sec, like it said. My hair is naturally wavy and took some time to straighten it with my old flat iron. This flat iron took less time. When I was straightening my hair, I did experience some static with my hair so it's not completely anti static. I also like the little lock to keep the panels together, very nice when traveling. Overall this product works like is says, took little time to straighten and purple is one of my favorite colors so that is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia G.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I have very thick almost straight hair but this straightener couldn’t take it. I tried curling and straightening in tiny sections and I was completely disappointed. I couldn’t get a curl to save my life and I had to go over the same tiny piece several times to get it fully straight. I was hoping I could get away with a cheaper one but this honestly isn’t worth it, total waste of money. Invest in a really good hair tool this one isn’t it.
customer_reviews.author: Anna K.

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: i have long been using Remington flat irons. In fact, I don't know that I have ever had a different brand. Like all their others, this was inexpensive and lives up to expectations. I keep one at home and the other thrown in my gym bag for post-workout clean up. These heat up quickly, can be adjusted to a range of different temperatures, and are easy to read and work with.
customer_reviews.author: Tonia

product_meta.title: Remington S5500 1" Anti-Static Flat Iron with Floating Ceramic Plates and Digital Controls, Hair Straightener, Purple
product_meta.description: Color:PurpleStyle with the #1 best selling straightener ! The REMINGTON 1” Anti-Static Flat Iron reduces the amount of negatively charged particles during styling for 50% less static and fly aways. The ceramic plates with titanium protection coating heat up fast to create a smooth glide. The 1” plates are 30% longer1 for quick styling and easy control. The digital controls with LCD screen make it easy for you to find the temperature you prefer for your hair type, with a range of six heat settings from 310°F to 410°F. Nielsen US POS Data, 52 weeks, units, ending 2/10/2018 vs. Remington standard ceramic straightener1vs. 85mm straightener plates.
feature_bullets: Anti-Static Technology for 50% Less Static** & Fly aways
Titanium Protection Coating for Fast Heat Up & Styling
30% Longer1 Ceramic Plates for Quicker Styling and Less Damage
410°F High Heat for Fast Styling. Note : Refer to the PDF attached below in Technical Specification for manual

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
